title: Giuliano da Empoli: 'The engineers of chaos multiply anger and frustration using algorithms'
summary: The Swiss-Italian author of 'The Wizard of the Kremlin' discusses, in an interview with Le Monde, the responsibility that progressives have in the rise of authoritarian leaders backed by tech magnates.

title: World Health Organization to slash jobs and programs amid massive US funding cuts
summary: The US funding cut has blown a half-billion dollar hole in its budget, leading to a 'very painful' shortfall.

title: Zelensky says Ukraine is ready for direct talks with Russia, but only after a ceasefire
summary: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said Tuesday that the conflict was too 'complex' to achieve a speedy ceasefire.

title: PSG draw with Nantes to stay undefeated in Ligue 1
summary: On Tuesday, Paris Saint-Germain and Nantes reached a final score of 1-1. The draw leaves them just four Ligue 1 matches away from becoming the first team ever to complete a French top-flight campaign without losing.

title: Musk says his 'time allocation' with DOGE will 'drop significantly' after Tesla announces profits fell by over 70%
summary: Many investors have complained that co-founder and CEO Elon Musk is too distracted with his Trump administration role to be running Tesla and that he should either relinquish his position as CEO or abandon his advisory role in Washington.

title: Rekindled love: 'What if it started again, and he left me? And if I couldn't recover?'
summary: They met, fell in love, and parted ways. Then, the whirlwind of life brought them back together. Laurence, 62, shares her story with Thomas, 65.

title: Kevin Farrell, the American cardinal holding the Vatican's keys
summary: Acting as the Holy See's 'interim' leader until the election of Pope Francis's successor, the Camerlengo is tasked with organizing the late pope's monumental funeral, as thousands of faithful and world leaders head to the Vatican.

title: Islamist leader labeled a 'significant terrorist' by Israeli army is killed in Israeli strikes on Lebanon
summary: Lebanese Islamist group Jamaa Islamiya in a statement announced the death of Hussein Atwi, calling him 'an academic leader and university professor' and saying an Israeli drone strike 'targeted his car as he was travelling to his workplace in Beirut.'

title: Pope Francis: Three years of missteps and errors in judgment on the war in Ukraine
summary: Francis was resolutely pacifist, and continuously called for an end to the fighting. But some of his comments were deemed inappropriate.

title: Trump administration moves to ban artificial food dyes by 2026
summary: Health officials have hailed the decision as a major victory for public health and children's safety.

title: IMF forecasts global slowdown: 'The economy is entering a new era,' says chief economist
summary: The International Monetary Fund has revised its global growth projections downward to 2.8% in 2025 and 3% in 2026. The main reasons are the tariff hikes initiated by Donald Trump and the uncertainties they create. In an interview with Le Monde, Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas argues that the trade system needs an overhaul.

title: World expos: From Paris 1855 to Osaka 2025, what purpose do they serve?
summary: The World Expo has recently opened its doors in Osaka, Japan. Since the first edition in London in 1851, these global events have left a lasting impact on the cultural and architectural history of their host countries.

title: Pope Francis's death: French right and far right hold back their criticisms
summary: Although he had been a target of far-right attacks throughout his papacy, the pope, who was committed to supporting migrants, was commemorated with a rare unanimous tone after his death.

title: China calls on patriotism to save its exporters
summary: Faced with a 145% increase in US tariffs, displays of solidarity are multiplying among small and medium-sized enterprises, as well as major Chinese corporations. Businesses are rallying around patriotism to save Xi Jinping's economic model, writes Le Monde's Harold Thibault in his column.

title: Wall Street shockwaves continue after Trump's latest attacks on Fed
summary: The president of the United States once again targeted the Federal Reserve, the American central bank. The result was investor panic, causing a stock market drop, an interest rate hike and a dollar downturn.

title: European intelligence services worry about future of cooperation with US
summary: Amid uncertainty over Washington's direction since Donald Trump returned to the White House, Europeans are questioning what strategy to adopt in intelligence matters.

title: India: Gunmen kill at least 20 tourists in Kashmir
summary: Police described the incident as a 'terror attack' and blamed militants fighting against Indian rule. It appeared to be a major shift in the regional conflict, in which tourists have largely been spared.

title: Over 100 US universities denounce Trump administration 'political inteference'
summary: In a joint letter with signatories including Ivy League schools such as Yale, Princeton and Brown, the universities denounced 'political interference.' Harvard University also sued the Trump administration, on Monday.

title: Dominique de Villepin is having a moment. But French conservatives aren't interested
summary: The former French prime minister and foreign minister, most famous for making a speech at the UN in 2003 to oppose the Iraq War, is enjoying a resurgence in popularity – except on his own side of the political spectrum.

title: UK prepares for new round of Ukraine talks as US signals policy shift
summary: Britain is hosting a fresh round of Ukraine peace talks on Wednesday as the Trump administration intensifies efforts to end the war, including a controversial push to recognize Crimea as Russian territory.

title: How China dominates the automotive industry, leading Western manufacturers to imitate it
summary: 'The Chinese Automotive Superpower' (1/3). The Shanghai Auto Show, which opens on Wednesday, highlights China's dominance in the global automotive industry, particularly in electric vehicles and smart technology.

title: Emmanuel Macron's diplomacy in the Indian Ocean faces colonial contentions
summary: After visiting Mayotte and Reunion Island, the French president headed to Madagascar, to continue his Indian Ocean tour. During this visit, Comoros and Mauritius are expected to reiterate their territorial claims.

title: Trump administration backtracks amid global market panic
summary: Donald Trump, Elon Musk, and US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent have backed down on firing the Fed chair, on DOGE, and on tariffs on China. They are looking to reassure markets and win dissatisfied Americans back.

title: EU fines Apple €500 million and Meta €200 million
summary: The two tech giants failed to comply with the EU's Digital Markets Act, the European Commission found.

title: Left-wing French delegation denied visas by Israel
summary: A delegation of left-wing lawmakers and elected officials on Tuesday condemned a 'collective punishment' after their visas were canceled two days before a planned trip to Israel.

title: Pope Francis's coffin transferred to St Peter's Basilica
summary: Bells from the basilica rang out as Pope Francis's open coffin was carried in procession past packed crowds in St Peter's Square, accompanied by red-robed cardinals and the Vatican's Swiss Guards.

title: 40 years of France hesitating to recognize a Palestinian state
summary: Before Emmanuel Macron, other former French presidents made promises on this issue, but none materialized. The question is as much a matter of domestic politics as of foreign policy.

title: French minister visits Iraq to discuss two-state solution in Palestinian-Israeli conflict
summary: The French Foreign Ministry said in a statement that Jean-Noël Barrot is on a tour to help 'prepare for the international conference for the implementation of the two-state solution' that Paris will co-organize in June with Saudi Arabia.
